work.name: Laboratory of Theoretical Biochemistry, IBPC · CNRS

v1:academic: Led the writing of the first detailed review article on interactive molecular simulations (IMS) \cite{lanrezac2022} synthesizing decades of community research and published in a high-impact journal
Enhanced a 3D molecular visualization interface (Unity, \Cs) for real-time interaction and visualization of protein-membrane insertion studies \cite{lanrezac2022a,lanrezac2023a}
Standardized multi-threaded workflows (\Cpp, \Cs) for real-time simulation control and monitoring, enabling seamless data exchange and live analysis of system state properties
Developed specialized Python algorithms adapting all-atom implicit membrane models to coarse-grained Martini3, enabling interactive simulations with curved membrane geometries \cite{lanrezac2023a}
Built a CI/CD pipeline (GitHub Actions, Docker) automating simulation engine releases, resolving multi-year dependency issues, and ensuring broader software accessibility
v2:IT: Developed a Python algorithm to estimate interaction parameters between a reduced-resolution particle system and an analytical field, allowing large-scale dynamic simulations \cite{lanrezac2023a}
Standardized multi-threaded workflows (\Cpp, \Cs) for real-time molecular simulation control and monitoring, ensuring seamless and extensible data exchange

Enhanced a 3D visualization interface (Unity, \Cs) for real-time Human-computer interaction and visualization of the complex dynamics of molecular shapes and their spatial evolution \cite{lanrezac2022a,lanrezac2023a}
Implemented a CI/CD pipeline (GitHub Actions, Docker), automating software releases, resolving dependency issues, and improving accessibility for end-users
Led the writing of the first review article on interactive molecular simulations (IMS) \cite{lanrezac2022}, synthesizing decades of community research

work.name: Bioinformatics and biophysics team, IMPMC · Sorbonne université
work.institution: Institute of Mineralogy, Physics of Materials and Cosmochemistry (IMPMC)

v1:academic: Developed a workflow combining Autodock with REMD simulations in GROMACS (using a national supercomputer), and compared the results with HADDOCK
Manual design of cyclic peptides with UCSF-Chimera
v2:IT: Developed a workflow combining molecular docking and sampling simulations using a national supercomputer, with results compared to alternative methods
Designed cyclic peptides using molecular visualization and modeling tools

work.name: Bioinformatics Research Team, ISYEB · Sorbonne université
work.institution: Institute of Systematics, Evolution and Biodiversity

v1:academic: Optimized a protein similarity search by re-implementing Bellman's algorithm (Python) to find the longest path through shared motifs, and developing heuristic algorithms for faster matching
v2:IT: Optimized a protein similarity search by re-implementing Bellman's algorithm (Python) to find the longest path through shared motifs, and developing heuristic algorithms for faster matching

courses: Interpretation of experimental data through interactive simulation and molecular visualization
